metadata.title: CVE-2019-19816 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystem image andperforming some operations can cause slab-out-of-bounds write access in__btrfs_map_block in fs/btrfs/volumes.c, because a value of 1 for thenumber of data stripes is mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-201-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-201-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-201-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-112-generic - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-112-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-112-lowlatency - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-112-generic - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-112-lowlatency - 4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1087-kvm - 4.4.0-1087.96
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1079-aws - 4.15.0-1079.83~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-azure - 4.15.0-1091.101~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1080-gcp - 4.15.0-1080.90~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1050-oracle - 4.15.0-1050.54~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1145-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1145.155
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1149-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1149.159
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1055-fips - 4.4.0-1055.61
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1055-fips - 4.4.0-1055.61
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1055-fips - 4.4.0-1055.61
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1055-fips - 4.4.0-1055.61
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-201.233').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1087.96').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.135').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1079.83~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.101~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.90~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.54~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1145.155').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1149.159').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1055.61').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
